result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:02 PM Defendant Kevin Nguyen appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Angela Raye Olson appeared by video for Kevin Nguyen. Attorney Bruce Rivers appeared by video for Kevin Nguyen.  Attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for State of Wisconsin. Vietnamese Interpreter, Hoanchau Nguyen in court, sworn. Counsel previously efiled waiver of preliminary hearing. Court examines Defendant, accepts said waiver, and binds matter over for trial. State files the information. Counsel waives reading of information and enters not guilty plea. Counsel to file bail motion.
Further proceedings scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Further proceedings on December 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Atty Olson re: Request to Appear by Zoom.  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 2 Clerk.
Forwarded as document for review to Branch 2 Clerk.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
10/27 hearing time changed from 2pm to 3pm to due to interpreters schedule. Clerk emailed counsel.
Proof of Opt In Payment on 10-7-22

8:40 AM Defendant Kevin Nguyen appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Angela Raye Olson and Bruce Rivers appeared by video for Kevin Nguyen.  Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Vietnamese Interpreter, Hoanchau Nguyen, via video, sworn. Counsel requests preliminary hearing waiving time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Granting Motion to Appear Pro Hac Vice
Court grants counsel request for zoom appearance for 10/10 hearing. Clerk emailed counsel zoom information.

Granting Motion to Appear Pro Hac Vice

Letter Attorney Olson RE: Pro Hac Vice

Adjustment Number: 22A 150847,
Payable Number: 142322,
Receipt Number: 22R 010340,
Amount: $20.00

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Not to leave the State of Wisconsin. Surrender passport to law enforcement. No contact with Victim's Family. Defendant to avoid the victim's family's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by them. The defendant avoid contacting them or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact them. Contact includes: contact at their home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner.

1:05 PM Defendant Kevin Nguyen appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin. Vietnamese Interpreter Hoanchau Nguyen via video, sworn. Attorney Rivers appears via video and advises family is in process of retaining and observing only for today. Statement by attorney Boaz on representation. Court advises of charge/penalty and finds probable cause. Court advises of right to counsel. State recommends $250,000 cash bail with conditions. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.
